intro: Couratari riparia, commonly known as the river sycamore, is a tropical tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and broad, palmately lobed leaves. The plant is often found in moist, lowland forests and riparian zones, thriving in humid environments. Its fruit is a drupe, containing a single seed enclosed in a fleshy, aromatic pulp. Couratari riparia plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
